activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Karl Dallmann

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Karl Dallmann appeared by video.  Attorney Phillip Brehm appeared by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney enters a not guilty plea and matter to be set. Bond continued.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon Karl Dallmann appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Brandon Karl Dallmann. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.M.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 1PM.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.M.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.
